content.rendered:
Wordpress Website Design Company

We create customizable WordPress websites customers love.

Trusted By

Developed for enterprise use.

Speed, security, third-party integrations, SEO, and flexibility are paramount for mature businesses. Our custom WordPress solutions have been tailored to address these needs and more.

100% Custom Theme

Our homegrown WordPress theme, dubbed “Space Station” is designed to be efficient unlike other popular themes such as Divi.

User Behavior Tracking

We track user sessions with visual data tools to analyze your customer’s current user experience.

A design that makes the best first impression.

Your brand is rapidly growing and your industry is constantly changing. Our custom templates are built to grow with you.

Future Planning

We’ve worked with 100+ brands over 10 years. We use that experience to help you predict and incorporate future needs into the site build.

Highly-Customizable Themes

Our custom themes for Shopify and WordPress maximize your ability to edit, update, and expand your website over time.

A customer-centric approach that drives action.

Your website needs to be more than just amazing at the surface level. Our user-centric design approach makes sure every touchpoint of a website is well thought out.

Style Guides

We create visual style guides that ensure design consistency from top to bottom.

Interaction Design

We focus on micro-interactions throughout your site to improve customer experience.

Featured Websites 🔥

Here’s a small selection of our WordPress website design agencies most recent project launches. Want to see more? Check out our case studies.

We partnered with AgAmerica to transform their corporate website and improve the volume of qualified leads by 124%.
View Case Study

Ag America
Corporate | WordPress | B2B | Build

We partnered with ExtensisHR to help them with a full rebrand and redesign of their corporate website.
View Case Study

ExtensisHR
Corporate | WordPress | B2B | Build

We helped this premium interiors company elevate their online presence.
View Case Study

Stone Source
Industrial | WordPress | B2B | Build

We partnered with Aerotech to develop their global corporate website.
View Case Study

Aerotech
Corporate | Woocommerce | WordPress | B2B | Build

Curious what your project may cost?

Try Our Project Calculator
Slider rows are not rendered while builder is active
Slider rows are not rendered while builder is active

Are we a match?

We would love the opportunity to work with you, but understand that you may have some additional questions. This quick Q&A covers a lot of the basics. If you have any additional questions don’t hesitate to reach out.

How much will it cost to design and develop my WordPress website?

Our average WordPress website redesign averages $50,000-$100,000 based on the size and complexity of the online store. This is inclusive of a two-day strategy workshop, full UI/UX design, custom theme development, content writing, and on-site SEO. For a more accurate estimate, be sure to check out our project calculator.

 

If you’re not looking to redesign your entire WordPress website and would rather work on your existing website, we offer Grow packages starting at $5,000/month. You can find out more about that here.

How long does it take to build my WordPress website?

Similar to questions regarding website cost, the timeline will vary greatly based on the scope of your web design project. Typically, our end-to-end build projects take 4-6 months to complete.

What types of WordPress clients do you work with & what’s your past experience?

We predominantly design WordPress websites for SaaS companies, industrial/manufactures, professional services, and technology companies but have experience across a number of other categories.

 

To get a better sense of who we’ve worked with, check out our client’s list.

Where is your team located?

Our headquarters is located in Pittsburgh, PA and we have a satellite office located in New York, NY. We also have some remote employees in Utah, Florida, Los Angeles, and Ohio.

What’s a typical client engagement with your company like?

The core of our teams is comprised of 1 project manager, 1 creative director, 1 web designer, 1 web developer, 1 copywriter, 1 digital marketer, and 1 QA specialist. Beyond that, we may add additional web designers or web developers based on the size of your web design project. We may also add on additional employees focused on illustration or motion graphics depending on your needs.

 

Clients can expect daily communication with their team via E-mail, Slack, or Asana and ‘all hands on deck’ meetings once a week via video conferencing.

 

Ultimately, we try to make ourselves as available as possible while still leaving room for us to make meaningful progress on our client’s projects.

Can you work with my existing Marketing team?

Absolutely. It’s common for our WordPress website design company to collaborate with internal or external digital marketing teams.

 

Throughout the course of a project, we often help these teams set a better structural foundation for SEO, set up smarter segmentation, improve goal and event tracking.

 

Post-launch we can collaborate with your marketing team to produce new landing pages, website sections, lead magnets, or assist with aspects of the marketing work ourselves.

Can you migrate my existing website to WordPress?

Absolutely!

 

Our WordPress website design company helps brands migrate between different CMS’s quite frequently.

 

Our WordPress experts will handle the data migration of posts, custom post types, taxonomies, users, as well as third party integrations with your CRM, ATS, IMS and other order management systems.

What WordPress theme do you use?

Unlike some of our competitors, we don’t actually rely on any third-party themes.

 

We’ve developed our own custom WordPress website theme dubbed ‘Space Station for WordPress’. Space Station is a minimalist base theme optimized for things like:

  • Page Speed
  • Flexible Content Sections
  • Search Engine Optimization

 

With this solid foundation in place, we then develop completely custom child themes via our WordPress website design services for each of our clients that take advantage of these optimizations.

How does your company ensure WordPress websites remain secure?

We have a few different precautions in place to ensure the WordPress websites we build are safe:

  • All employees use password encryption to receive and share log-in information
  • We limit the number of third-party plug-ins to there bare minimum
  • Core and plug-in updates are performed frequently to mitigate the risk of vulnerabilities
  • Third-party traffic intermediaries (such as CloudFlare) are used block and prevent malicious attacks on the site

For a more comprehensive understanding of what else we do, check our our article on WordPress security best practices.

My company doesn’t have a WordPress developer on staff. Do you offer long-term support?

Absolutely. In fact, over 90% of our website redesign clients transition into long-term support clients. To learn more about our offerings regarding support, follow this link.

Am I a better fit for Build or Grow?

Everyone has different business goals. Here’s how we typically decide what service our clients are a better fit for:

 

Build engagements are best for organizations undergoing a major rebranding, looking to migrate from a different content management system (CMS) or have larger, structural issues with their current WordPress website.

 

Grow engagements are best for organizations that have an established WordPress website they’re comfortable with and are looking to increase conversions, sales, and improve overall customer experience.

What does a Build engagement entail? Timeline & Budget
Our build engagements typically last 4-6 months and cost $50,000-$100,000 USD.

 

Project Kick-off
We start with an in-person or virtual project kick-off that often takes place over the course of 1-2 days. In this kick-off, our team will perform a series of exercises to better understand your brand, your customers, current challenges with your existing website, and goals for future growth. We’ll also dig into things like website structure, categorization, and design.

 

Strategy & Design
We’ll then create a series of documents such as a key takeaways document, user personas, user flow charts, initial website wireframes, and mood boards.

Based on our research and observed user behavior we’ll iterate with your team in a collaborative fashion to create a WordPress website design that both you, and your customers will love.

 

Development & QA
After we’ve both arrived at a point with the visual design where we’re completely satisfied we’ll transition over to development. Our WordPress website design team creates comprehensive visual guidelines for our development team to execute.

Our approach to QA has five layers:

  • A round of technical QA performed by your Web Developer.
  • A round of visual QA performed by your UI/UX designer
  • A round of functional QA performed by a Quality Analyst
  • A round of holistic QA performed by our broader team
  • A round of holistic QA performed by your team

This multi-layered approach ensures our website’s launch and performs flawlessly day one.

What does the 6-month Grow engagement entail?

Our WordPress website design company has designed a 6-month roadmap to study your website traffic, observe issues/opportunities with user experience, identify quick wins, and systematically execute and measure improvements to the site.

 

Month 1 – CRO Audit

Through a mix of user testing and data analysis, we’ll perform a CRO audit of your current website. We’ll focus on Mobile, Desktop, and Performance opportunities. Some of the key things we’ll identify are:

  • Priority levels
  • Problems/Opportunities
  • Potential Solutions
  • Issue Types (Design, Technical, Conversion, Internal)
  • Bucket (Quick Win, Test, Other)
Month 2 – Roadmap + Quick Wins
Our teams will collaborate by taking our findings and creating a 6 month Grow roadmap. From this, you’ll have a clear understanding of where we’re going to have the biggest impact. This month we’ll also focus on executing the quick wins adjustments.

 

Months 3 – 6 – Improvements, Testing, and Reporting
Our dedicated team of experts will systematically perform conversion tests and make website improvements that result in higher conversions and increased revenue. Walking you through the how, why, and impact, every step of the way. Has your WordPress design agency won any awards?

Our WordPress agency has been awarded top 10 ratings from Clutch in the categories of web design, top web developer, and user experience design for 5 years in a row.

 

Our client work has been awarded by pretty much all of the major critics in our industry. We’ve received numerous awards from The Webby’s, Ad Age, The Davey’s, W3 Awards, Horizon Interactive Awards, Interactive Media Awards, FixThePhoto, and more.

Are you ready for a memorable website?

Find out how we can help you achieve your goals by setting up a call with Mike, our co-founder.

Contact Us
